meanings.definition: Available for use at one's own discretion.
meanings.sent1: She had discretionary funds to spend as she pleased.
meanings.sent2: He made a discretionary decision to take a day off work.
meanings.sent3: The cat had a discretionary choice of napping spots in the house.
meanings.sent4: The artist used discretionary colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent5: The discretionary power of the queen allowed her to pardon the prisoner.

meanings.sent1: The discretionary task was completed according to his own plan.
meanings.sent2: She left the menu items discretionary for the guests to choose.
meanings.sent3: The dog's discretionary behavior led to him choosing the comfiest bed.
meanings.sent4: The discretionary path through the forest was filled with surprises.
meanings.sent5: His discretionary approach to problem-solving impressed his colleagues.

meanings.sent1: The discretionary matter was resolved in a fair manner.
meanings.sent2: She found the discretionary rules easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The discretionary weather made it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent4: His discretionary schedule allowed for spontaneous adventures.
meanings.sent5: The discretionary nature of the project gave her freedom to innovate.
